dogecoin.text: @PiccoloNamekGod @X1_blockchain @lavanetxyz @Starknet @dogecoin @_Bellscoin Its a dedicated bare metal server via Contabo.

1 validator node @X1_blockchain 
2 PoS nodes @lavanetxyz and @Starknet 
2 PoW nodes @dogecoin and @_Bellscoin 

Maximizing rent. https://t.co/CB35BVwTjy

cd
cd dogecoin-1.14.6/bin
./dogecoin-cli stop
pause
cd
mv dogecoin-1.14.6 doge-old
wget https://t.co/QPybvGltCU
tar -xvzf dogecoin-1.14.7-x86_64-linux-gnu.tar.gz
cd dogecoin-1.14.7/bin
./dogecoind -daemon

6/ Run the new Dogecoin core.

From root directory, navigate to Dogecoin folder

cd dogecoin-1.14.7
cd bin
./dogecoind -daemon

Note:
Optional step, renamed the folder to just "doge". As shown on the screenshot below https://t.co/IOWMu6hHog

5/ Extract the tar

tar -xvzf dogecoin-1.14.7-x86_64-linux-gnu.tar.gz

Wait for extract to complete https://t.co/YY05delfxW

3/ Rename old Core folder

From root directory:

cd
mv dogecoin-1.14.6 doge-old

Note:
My core is named "doge" so I just rename it back to original folder named "dogecoin-1.14.6. See screenshot. https://t.co/TrlBCVQpfa

2/ Stopping your Dogecoin Core!

From root directory:

cd dogecoin-1.14.6
cd bin
./dogecoin-cli stop

Wait until the core is completely stopped

Note: 
In may case I have renamed it to just "doge" as shown on the screenshot. https://t.co/dMjaWBIvff

1/ Backup your wallet!

On your terminal, go to root directory:

cd
cd ~/.dogecoin
cp wallet.dat <backup location> https://t.co/qBLYkfSqnw

Update your @dogecoin  core to 1.14.7
https://t.co/Z3AtH2SWRD

It will be a quick simple process. Steps involve backing up your "wallet.dat", stopping daemon, renaming folder, downloading new core and running it.

If you are on LInux, here are the the commands.
